H0.text: Protons are the identifying characteristic of an element.

H1.text: Neutrons are the identifying characteristic of an element, representing its number.

H2.text: Electrons are the identifying characteristic of an element, being its number of electrons.

H3.text: Orbitals are the identifying characteristic of an element, meaning the number of orbitals a given element possesses defines its identity.

A4.text: The atomic number can be used to uniquely identify ordinary chemical elements.

A5.text: Atoms with the same atomic number but different neutron numbers, and hence different mass numbers, are known as isotopes.
